[[File:Steven White Jr. - Frodo's Journey.gif|thumb|300px|The route of Frodo's journey from [[Hobbiton]] to [[Mount Doom]].]]
{{quote|For Frodo the Halfling, it is said, at the bidding of Mithrandir took on himself the burden, and alone with his servant he passed through peril and darkness and came at last in Sauron's despite even to Mount Doom; and there into the Fire where it was wrought he cast the Great Ring of Power, and so at last it was unmade and its evil consumed.|''[[Of the Rings of Power and the Third Age]]''}}

The '''Quest of Mount Doom''',<ref>{{FR|II2}}</ref> also known as the '''Quest of the Ring-bearer'''<ref>{{TT|Synopsis}}</ref><ref>{{RK|Synopsis}}</ref> and the '''Quest of the Ring''',<ref>{{L|183}}</ref> was the quest taken by the members of the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] to destroy [[the One Ring]] of [[Sauron]] to rid the evil from [[Middle-earth]] during the [[Third Age]]. It forms the center of the story of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.

==History==
Though its necessity was obvious to many beforehand, the Quest was initiated during the [[Council of Elrond]]. [[Elrond]] appointed eight members to accompany the [[Ring-bearers|ring-bearer]] [[Frodo Baggins]] on his difficult journey: [[Gandalf]], [[Aragorn]], [[Legolas]], [[Gimli]], [[Boromir]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]. Merry and Pippin were not chosen, but went on their own consent.<ref>{{FR|Council}}</ref> After spending the autumn in [[Rivendell]], the Company set off on the arduous journey that lay ahead.

They set off for [[Eregion]], and attempted to cross the [[Misty Mountains]] at the [[Redhorn Pass]].<ref>{{FR|South}}</ref> Stopped by snow, the Fellowship sought a different path: the long dark of [[Moria]].<ref>{{FR|Journey}}</ref> There, [[Gandalf]] fell in battle with [[Durin's Bane]].<ref>{{FR|Bridge}}</ref>

The remaining eight members of the Fellowship, now led by Aragorn, entered [[Lothlórien]], where they spent a month in the care of [[Celeborn]] and [[Galadriel]].<ref>{{FR|Lorien}}</ref> They departed by swift Elven boats, and headed South over the [[Anduin]].<ref>{{FR|Farewell}}</ref>

And so they came to [[Nen Hithoel]] and the [[Emyn Muil]], where Boromir was slain, and the Fellowship was broken.<ref>{{TT|Departure}}</ref> Frodo and Sam crossed the river to the east and, after much toil, escaped the hills.<ref>{{TT|Taming}}</ref> With the help of [[Gollum]], they crossed the [[Dead Marshes]], and came in sight of the [[Black Gate]].<ref>{{TT|Marshes}}</ref><ref>{{TT|Gate}}</ref> Unable to enter [[Mordor]], they went to the pass of [[Cirith Ungol]], but were divided by the treachery of Gollum. Frodo was stung by [[Shelob]] and taken prisoner.<ref name="TTChoices">{{TT|Choices}}</ref> At the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]], he was stripped of his effects, but Sam managed to free him.<ref>{{RK|Tower}}</ref> The Ring had, at this stage, been taken by Sam, for safe-keeping.<ref name="TTChoices" />

Frodo and Sam continued their way, via the [[Carach Angren|Isenmouthe]], to [[Mount Doom]]. Gollum appeared one last time to seize the [[The One Ring|Ring]], but fell with it to his death into the fiery chasm of Mount Doom.<ref>{{RK|Doom}}</ref>
